column4: I installed nginx from src, how can I remove it and install it from aptitude?
did you add the prefix option on configuring the nginx
it was a year ago, I haven't the foggiest
it seems to follow the linux style of putting pieces of itself all over the place, so not confident I can just delete it
going to try make uninstall
does it mean you don't have the orginal source code  ?
I do
ls
hmm
if you don't have the source pakage, it's difficult to remove the compiled nginx
just try install the nginx from repos, and it maybe overwirte the compiled version
I just did that, it works, but the one from repos doesn't seem to have ssl, which is the whole reason I wanted it, :(
think I have to remove it and then reinstall from src with ssl enabled
good luck to me...
what's the result of "apt-cache search nginx"?
maybe the ssl has been provided in other packages
nope, guess not
still have the source here, just going to try that now
so why don't you build the nginx from source again?
building as we speak, so far, so good :)
good :)
worked! thanks for your help
u r welcome :)
